inn1.comm: starts off with a decent line and length delivery outside the off stump, Parchment shoulders arms
bit of away movement, Parchment reads it well and leaves it through to the keeper
and a Pollock beauty! in the channel outside the off stump and shaping away late, Parchment pushes down the wrong line and the ball goes past the outside edge
closer to the off stump line, Parchment gets behind the line and defends it down towards cover, much better shot
touch too wide outside the off stump - no shot offered
and he starts off with a maiden. Once again Pollock gets the ball to shape away late but was bit too wide outside the off stump to trouble the batsman
shot! in the slot outside the off stump, Smith lines it up nicely and hammers it past the fielder at mid-off
wayward delivery down the leg side, Smith has a waft at it but fails to connect
smashed through cover this time! another over pitched delivery outside the off stump and Smith finds the gap between the cover fielders
forced away towards cover
defended down on the leg side
drifting down the leg side and the ball rolls away off the pad
bit of away movement but the line is not right - too wide to interest the batsman
drifts on to the pads and Smith clips it away well wide of the fielder at square leg
good length delivery outside the off stump and Parchment is off the mark with an edge down to third man
down the wicket  and swings hard - missed the target by miles there
short of a good length delivery, bit of angle across the left-hander. Smith is made to play off the back-foot and the ball zips past the outside the edge
once again the line and length is perfect and Smith taps it away straight to the fielder at cover
good length and this one nipped back in sharply. Smith is beaten by the movement and the ball rolls away off the pad
down the leg side and the ball brushes the pad on its way to the keeper

good length and this one straightened after hitting the deck - the ball did pitch in line and hits the pad right in front of the stumps. Loud appeal for lbw turned down. Decent enough shout, height could have been a factor
edged past the diving fielder at second slip
goes for the pull and the ball rolls away off the inner half of the bat
short and wide outside the off stump, was there to be hit and Smith duly cuts it away to the point boundary. Easy runs
better line and length from Steyn, Smith gets forward and drives it straight to the fielder at cover
in and around the off stump line, Parchment taps it away off the front-foot
Pollock strikes! pitched up and shaping away a touch, Parchment drives - reaching for the ball outside the off stump and the de Villiers at point makes no mistake.
off the mark straightaway, good length delivery on the pads and Chanderpaul nicely tucks it away behind square
short of a good length delivery outside the off stump, bit of away movement and Chanderpaul leaves it through to the keeper
pitched wide and shaping away further, Chanderpaul shoulders arms
short rising delivery outside the off stumps, Chanderpaul pokes at it half heartedly and the ball goes through to the keeper. End of a successful over
good length delivery outside the off stump, coming in with the angle and Smith taps it away towards point
drifting down the leg side and the ball rolls away in front of square leg, dangerous single called and they scamper through
short delivery outside the off stump, Chanderpaul moves across a bit and works it away towards square leg for an easy single
take that! short delivery outside the off stump, Smith picks it up early and pulls it away through midwicket. Got right on top of the bounce and hit it hard into the ground - that's the way to do it
forced away behind point, no room for a single there
good length delivery outside the off stump, no shot offered
drifting down the leg side, Chanderpaul moves across and tries to work it away fine but fails to make contact
half hearted shout for lbw turned down. Good length delivery on the middle and leg stump line, ball did pitch in line but was drifting down the leg side
left alone outside the off stump
wayward delivery outside the off stump
back to the channel outside the off stump. Chanderpaul watches it all the way in to the keeper's gloves
good length delivery on the pads, Chanderpaul fails to make contact and the ball rolls away off the pad
short of a good length delivery, close to the off stump line and Chanderpaul is beaten by the extra bounce. Well bowled Polly
pushed down to mid-on, the fielder is at the edge of the circle and they scamper through for a well judged single
good length delivery outside the off stump, Chanderpaul gets behind the line and defends it down on the off side
short of a good length delivery outside the off stump, Chanderpaul stands tall and plays it down towards point

almost! good length delivery on the middle and off stump line, Chanderpaul leans forward and tries to work it away through midwicket, ball clips the leading edge and goes over the fielders inside the circle on the off side.
cut away wide of the fielder at point
good length delivery, driven past the fielder at mid-off
he gets it right this time, good length delivery on the pads and Chanderpaul nicely works it away through midwicket for a brace
good length and angling across, Chanderpaul gets across and drives it straight to the fielder at mid-off
full and on the stumps, once again Chanderpaul finds the fielder at mid-off
short of a good length delivery, too close to cut and the ball rolls away off the bottom edge
left alone outside the off stump
on the pads, Chanderpaul is late on the flick and the ball thuds into the pad, another decent Pollock over comes to an end
Smith! good length delivery outside the off stump, came in with the angle. Smith just stood his ground and blasted it over the long-on fence. Good clean hit
defended off the back-foot

short delivery outside the off stump, Smith goes for the pull and the ball rolls away off the bottom edge to the cover region. Nel at his Shakespearian best reads out few lines from Tempest - page 55 I guess
forced away on the off side
width offered and Smith dispatches it behind point - made it look easy
short and wide outside the off stump, Smith comes down the track and lofts it over cover point, another clean hit. End of a fine over for West Indies
cut away towards gully
worked away off the pads to the square leg region
short and wide outside the off stump, Smith cut hard but makes no contact. Tried to hit it too hard rather than time the shot
clipped away off the pads, well past the fielder at mid-on and Smith comfortable makes it back for the second
drifting down the leg side and the ball rolls away off the pad, Nel gives chase from short fine leg but pulls away holding on to his hamstring.
good length delivery, Smith works it away towards cover
good length and shaping away from the left-hander, Chanderpaul has a poke at it and the ball goes past the outside edge, excellent delivery first up
low fulltoss on the middle and off stump line, Chanderpaul picks it up early and clips it away through the vacant midwicket region
pitched up and driven straight to the fielder at short cover
short of a good length delivery, angled across the left-hander. Chanderpaul leans back and cuts it away straight to the fielder at point
class! half volley outside the off stump, was the slower delivery - Chanderpaul reads it well, gets a good stride in and drives it through the gap between mid-off and cover. Excellent placement
50 partnership comes up - driven straight back down the track and past the fielder at mid-off.
good length delivery outside the off stump, Smith drives and the ball rolls away off the inner half of the bat. Quick single down to mid-off
tight delivery outside the off stump, Chanderpaul gets forward and defends it down on the off side
pitched up but once again no room offered - Chanderpaul gets forward and drives it down to mid-off
on the pads, flicked away straight to the fielder at midwicket
on the middle and leg stump, Chanderpaul leans forward and clips it away through midwicket
slower delivery to end the over, Chanderpaul tamely taps it away towards cover
fuller length delivery outside the off stump, Smith has a go at it but makes no contact
once again width offered outside the off stump and this time Smith cuts it down to third man for a single
worked away off the front-foot to the mid-on region, Both scores a direct hit at the bowler's end but Chanderpaul was never in trouble
good length delivery outside the off stump and Smith square drives it past the fielder at point. Another fabulous shot
angled across and the Smith misses out, ball rolls away off the pad and they stroll across for a single
forced away towards point

oh dear! short rising delivery outside the off stump, Smith cuts and the ball lobs up of the edge to the extra cover region. Ball was in the air for a long time but luckily for Smith it fell well wide of the fielders closing in from both sides
cut away through point
pitched up outside the off stump, was the slower ball - Smith just lined it up and lofted it down to the long-off fence. Steyn continues to be expensive

MAX! short delivery outside the off stump and Smith pulls it over the midwicket fence. It looked like he failed to time the shot but the ball kept going and in the end comfortably cleared the man in the deep
defended off the back-foot

six more! he is on a roll here - another short delivery, this time the pull shot is timed to perfection and the ball just sailed over the square leg fence. Another expensive over from Steyn comes to an end
forced away wide of the fielder at cover
width offered outside the off stump and at this pace... good looking cut and the ball screams away to the cover fence
another bad delivery but this time Smith finds the fielder at cover
nudged down to short third man for a single
Duminy oversteps - free hit coming up
and again - the free hit stays. Smith came down the track and missed it completely
once again Smith comes down the track and swings hard but fails to make contact. Boucher does not bother to take off the bails.
worked away through midwicket - normalcy restored
fired down the leg-side, and taken by the keeper
squared up by a straighter, fuller delivery. Smith closes the face too early and the ball squirts to gully
patted into the covers. Chanderpaul has a sharp word with his partner for not backing up
defended off the back foot
pushed onto the back foot, nudged into the covers
defended again, tidy stuff so far
good delivery to finish, bursts past the outside edge with extra kick off the seam. And that's the end of the over
beaten outside off stump, good delivery and a flinch of a defensive prod
whipped down the ground to long-on. Pollock fields to a big cheer
teasing length, there for the cut, but not quite there.
dabbed along the ground through the slips
driven into the covers
tidy line and length to finish, looped onto middle and off, and a hint of tweak away
width, and flailed. Long-off is posted, so that won't go for four, but it was travelling all the same
turned off the hip and fielded inside the 30-yard circle at fine leg
same shot, two runs this time, as Chanderpaul realises just how far the fielder has to travel
driven down the ground again, finding the gaps with aplomb now
played late and watchfully, nudged into the covers
turned off the hip to midwicket, another steady over of accumulation
a fraction too short, but certainly not a long-hop. A measured cut to deep point
looking for the big drive, but merely another single
worked into space in the covers
flicked off the pads, picked up by Pollock at long-on to squealing cheers again
finds the gap again, this time at point
short and cracked out to deep point, hit too well as Kallis fields, but that's a comfortable over of accumulation
full length, attempted yorker but a fraction too full. Dug out easily enough
defended out to point
back of a length and straight, nudged down to third man off the shoulder of the bat. Always in control
width, and that's a casual waft. Well, maybe waft is a bit harsh. He was flinging everything at that
short and clobbered through backward point, and de Villiers pulls off an incredible diving stop. Jolly well done there
fuller and straighter to finish
short and kicking high as it bounces outside off. Patted down to backward point with a measured cut
cracked into the deep again. Singles will do nicely
good delivery, teasing length, and that's met with the straightest of bats
worked into the covers
nearly beaten, Chanderpaul had to check his shot as he lost it in flight. But still picked up a single to cover
worked into the gap for another single. Only four off the over though. Better for South Africa
angled bat, dabbed down to third man
dabbed behind square off the back foot
half an appeal as Smith is rapped on the pads, but that pitched outside leg
walloped into the covers, and half a hand on the ball stops the boundary. But Dale Steyn at long-off sends in a wild throw that gifts a third run
tighter all round
pitches on leg stump, and turned behind square
looped onto middle and leg, pushed into the covers
good change of pace, tossed up much higher
shorter, but still no room for the cut
pushed down to long-off
gallops down the pitch for an aggressive drive, but de Villiers half-stops in the covers and chases down well. That could have been a run-out, but his throw went to the wrong end
another dot ball to finish. Duminy has done a very good job so far
width, and too full, and Smith reaches forward to drive elegantly through the covers. Just enough legs to beat Kallis in the deep. Top shot
a push into the deep this time. Good composure from Smith as he moves into the 90s
dabbed off the back foot, behind point
leg-stump line and dabbed for a single to short leg, but Chanderpaul had to scramble as the shy came in
opens the face, and glides another single to third man
forward into position for a clip through leg, but short midwicket intercepts
flight and loop, and fielded with a tumble at short cover
short, but onto Chanderpaul too slowly. He can't do anything but shovel the ball round the corner for a single
drawn forward to defend
good bowling again, taking all the pace off the ball
worked around the corner, but can't find space
another single to complete the over, but that's all that West Indies are dealing with right now
worked out to deep backward point
misdirected, speared way down the off side

that's the breakthrough! Short and wide again, but a fraction tighter than the last ball, and Smith can only feather a wild cut into Boucher's gloves. A great shame for West Indies, but how timely for South Africa
tucked off the hips, finds the gap
slower ball, looped up and driven into the covers
tight line, defended off middle stump
full length and tight to the stumps again. The end of a very good over
excellent start, swinging into Chanderpaul who gets a thick inside edge out to cover
tries to pull this but can't make contact...a nasty wide
punched out off the back foot
a very good length, if a little wide, and he crouches into a drive but can't time it
stands tall and whips this to mid-off with a nonchalant flick of the wrists
pushed to mid-on and he sets off for a single...but it's not on
ah, top shot - more nonchalance from Browne, flicking this leg-side stray through midwicket for four. No great power, just excellent timing
Chanderpaul is forward, squeezing this out square of the wicket
good length and swinging into Browne who is rapped on the pad, but it's probably going over the top. Very good length though; Browne wasn't sure whether to come forward or back
again, a good length and a better line on the off stump. Browne, without moving his feet, punches this confidently off the back foot
rubbish. Down the leg side. Next
again too straight, and Browne works it down to Pollock lurking at fine leg
well bowled! A simply marvellous slower ball which Chanderpaul misreads and he gets a leading edge
goddim! That's plumb. A very good length to Chanderpaul on leg stump, it bends back into his pads to the left-hander who over-balances and is trapped in front. Very well bowled
wide of the off stump and swinging wider still
that's a beauty from Steyn, swinging away from Browne's tentative push outside off. One of Steyn's unplayables
fuller and quicker and defended
lovely line and length. Squirted out to cover
ooh and he plays and misses outside off. Poor stroke. Not a lot of swing away from the right hander, but enough
ooh I thought that one had crept through his defence. It was Steyn's attempted magic ball - fired into middle-and-leg before bending away at the last moment
nervously prodded to point
solidly blocked out
swinging away from the right hander who ignores it
more swing, again left alone
better length and he's forced to defend off the back foot
nicely played. On the back foot, he waited for it and guided it out to point
edged! It was full and wide and he went for an extravagant cover drive, it took the outside edge and flew short and wide of a diving Boucher
defended off the back foot
beaten by a fine ball which holds its line on Browne
fuller and a little slower, squeezed out to backward point who - oh ho! - misfields
left alone outside off, and it dies on Boucher
too wide, left alone
toe-ended to a diving Gibbs at slip
timed out to cover
gone! No? No. Wide of the off stump and he cut hard, convincing your commentator that there was a thin edge, but he's clearly deaf
what a shot that is. Outside off, he whipped it through midwicket with immense timing. Beautiful stroke - a Caribbean flick ala Des Haynes
good length and defended
flayed off the outside edge down to third man
defended on the front foot
wayward delivery outside the off stump
another one, almost similar line and length to the previous wide
good length delivery outside the off stump and Bravo drives it to sweeper cover for a single
forced away off the front-foot, cover fielder moves across and cuts off the single
good length delivery outside the off stump and Browne lofts it away to wide long-off, not a well timed shot though
cut away in front of point, fails to get it past the fielder there
excellent delivery, in the channel outside the off stump and shaping away a touch - Browne follows it as if it was a brownie and the ball zips past the outside edge
defended outside the off stump
driven into the covers and finds the gap well
tight to off stump and defended with a straight bat
a premeditated charge, but Pollock sees him coming and drops it short and into his pads, good bowling
flicked into the leg side
pitched on leg stump again, but can't work it away
clever steer through the vacant slip cordon, but JP Duminy gathers well on the third man boundary to save four
full length, nearly a yorker, well dug out
flogged off a good length, up and over cover. A hint of urgency about that stroke. The boundaries have dried up
worked off the hip, into space
there's the boundary. A attempted slower delivery turns into a half-volley, and crashes through midwicket
smashed up and over long-off for a maximum! Cracking full-blooded stroke. Bravo has taken West Indies' momentum as a personal quest
and just a single to finish a very productive over
swished into the leg-side, that's in the air for a long time, but plops safe
worked off the hip to backward square
completely squared up as Browne aimed across the line. Once again, the looping ball lands safe
coolly pushed down to mid-on
wicket-to-wicket, and worked off the stumps to backward square
full length seamer, and defended on off stump
keeping it full again, not a lot of movement but played respectfully on off stump
a fraction shorter and a hint of width, but short cover fields easily enough
unlucky! Good length seamer, takes the thick edge and Boucher can't intercept
pitched right up to the pads, defended
worked off the hips, and Kallis at square leg fumbles to gift a second run
tucked into the leg side again
down the ground in a pre-meditated wallop, massive anticipation as Morkel comes in at deep cover, but can't quite get there

on the spot, as you'd expect. Worked into the leg-side and that is the end of that. Twelve years of international cricket comes to an end for Shaun Pollock, and what a career it's been. 393 wickets at 24 in ODIs.
a big swing, and two more into the deep on the leg-side
busy feet at the crease, but played out to point with a straight bat

oops, that's a soft dismissal. Bravo was aiming to chip a leg-stump half-volley up and over midwicket, but a leading edge plops coolly into Graeme Smith's hands at mid-on. And that's the breakthrough that the entire crowd wish had come four balls ago ...
cramped for room, and defended into the leg side
worked into the leg side from an off-stump line, and he's off the mark
nudged leg-side again, and a scampered single to complete the over. Ten to go
bit of a loosener, full and wide outside off
lovely line and length, just fizzing past the edge and through to the keeper
turned to short midwicket
tight line, and just back of a length, worked uncomfortably into the leg-side
onto the back foot and played into the covers. Had to hurry as Duminy's shy comes in
attempted cut, but no width for the shot
on a good length and met with an elegant drive to long-off
a punchier stroke this time. Cover fields but can't stop the single
forward with an angled bat, third man sweeps in
nudged into the leg side with a big stride
massive appeal, and that looked mighty close to the naked eye. But it was full and angling down leg, which is where Morton was aiming
defended into the covers to complete a tidy over
oops, that slipped. A head-high full-toss, and Browne's spliced pull lands safe in the covers. Not that any catch would have counted, of course
better length, defended
he's gone this time! A regulation seamer in the channel outside off stump, the thinnest of feathered nicks as he tried to run the ball to third man, and Boucher completes the catch
width, and slashed into the gully, where de Villiers pounces
dabbed away, and he's off the mark
delicate late cut, and third man fields
tighter to off stump, defended off the back foot into the point region
dabbed into the off side again, but can't beat the field
tip and run off the pads, into space on the leg side
clobbered hard, all along the ground. Steyn does well to intercept at mid-off
down the track and heaved into space in the deep on the off side. The sweeper is there to tidy up, but that was an intentful shot, if such a word exists
very useful runs, a fraction too short, and steered incredibly fine through the vacant first slip. Boucher had no chance, nor did third man

full toss, swung high over the keeper's head, Boucher runs back to gather, and the umpires confer. Was it above waist height? Yes it was, but the wicket has fallen nonetheless. Ramdin can consider himself unlucky there
short, but not short enough. Sammy is too tall to pull that

turned into the leg side, Sammy calls for two straightaway, but it's always going to be tight. Steyn hurtles in from backward square, flat throw, great take from Boucher, and Sammy's bat is clearly in the air
ripper! Welcome to the crease, Rawl Lewis! He's been within himself so far, but that really took off, and Boucher had to jump like a Harrier to gather
not such an effective follow-up
props forward and gathered in the covers
defended and an instant call. de Villiers swoops from the covers, but Lewis is easily home
slower ball, tucked into the leg-side with a deft shimmy across the stumps. Great over
swished inside-edge, lucky not to play on, but fine leg is up and cuts off the boundary
full toss, but he gets away with it, thanks to an alert Smith diving away at midwicket
heave ho! That's a revolting swipe, and he doesn't come close to connecting
pushed into the covers
down the wicket, but Morkel responds with a yorker, angled into the pads. Good response
heaved into the leg side, but not timed again. Deep midwicket tidies up
full length, but too wide, and that's deftly steered off the face of the bat through third man
good change of pace, and that whistles clean over the top of the stumps as Browne dabs an air shot
measured push down to long-off
short, and smashed! Lewis picked that from the moment it left the hand, and that disappeared over midwicket. Top shot!
excellent response, yorker, right into the boot straps. Well dug out
smeared again! Wonderful strike, this time off the slower ball. He picked it well, dropped to one knee, and clattered that high into the midwicket stand
belted on one knee, very well timed, but deep cover is in position to field
pushed into the leg side, to Smith's left at short midwicket, and finds the gap well
much better length. A swing and a miss, and a tap of applause from Boucher as he gathers
thumped with brutal timing into the deep, but Botha makes excellent ground on the cover boundary, and restricts them to two
clumped out to Botha again, this time straight to him, but the same result
right in the blockhole, that's the death delivery
back-cut, another well placed stroke off the toe of the bat. Langeveldt tumbles on the third man boundary to field
excellent delivery, yorker length, but Morkel misfields to gift two runs.
down on one knee, still aiming for the full length. Duminy on the deep cover boundary fields
tighter line and length

another maximum from Lewis and that's the best of the lot. A low full-toss, which is often a good ball for this stage, but Lewis frees his arms and heaves high over long-off. Good catch in the crowd too
a better ball to finish, but that's a proper mauling for Steyn. Seventy-eight off his ten overs
full toss, nearly waist height. A baseball batter to Gibbs at cover, but he can't gather
well bowled, yorker length, Pollock fields at third man, to massive cheers. Naturally
smacked down the ground and fielded at long-on

brilliant catch! Quite brilliant! Browne launched a length delivery high and handsome over long-off. de Villiers pedalled back, leapt to intercept, and managed to keep his feet and weight inside the rope as he landed. Great balance. But hang on, the batsman has been called back, and de Villiers is livid! There was some doubt about his heel, according to the third umpire, but no evidence that he actually touched the rope at all
outside off and a big swing. An appeal from the keeper, possibly out of frustration at the last decision, and there's another replay! This is getting silly
outside off again, smashed into the covers, and that's the end of West Indies' best effort of the series

inn2.comm: width outside off stump, Gibbs isn't tempted at all
width again, but this time there's no stopping the batsman. Or the ball. It whistles through point for the first boundary of the innings
pace and carry, nip off the seam as well
in the corridor again. Too wide to tempt a stroke, but good pace through to the keeper
tidy line and length again. Hitting the seam as well, so Gibbs is well advised to leave alone at present
full length, ends up as a low full-toss outside off, but Gibbs misses out
edged, but drops short of second slip. Good lift outside off from Rampaul
outside off again, an attempted cut isn't quite timed
dramatic movement off the seam. The keeper does well to dive across first slip to take
back of a length, and Smith is instantly into position to pull. Not timed yet though
fuller length, nudged to midwicket
short and straight, and delicately steered wide of the diving point
wicket-to-wicket line and length, dabbed to leg and that's a disciplined first over
in the channel outside off
that's not the place to bowl to Smith. Full, and on the pads, whipped through midwicket with utter disdain
now that's the spot! Full and nipping back into the left-hander, Smith attempts to work to leg, but instead gets the thinnest of inside-edges onto his middle stump. That is a massive breakthrough
speared towards the pads, and nudged down to fine leg
that's the perfect channel for Gibbs. Pacy and hitting the seam, a foot outside off. He'll attack at his peril
good again, lifting off the pitch and passing under his armpit as he raises his bat
short and fading to the leg side, Kallis needs no invitation to cash in with a firm clip
similar shot, but fine leg is squarer this time and intercepts with ease
pushed off the pads, and collected in the deep as midwicket jogs back
tidy line and length, and a very well-judged leave as the ball fizzes through to the keeper
good again, six inches outside off stump, and a full length too. Gibbs might have been tempted to have a go at that, but he's conditioned himself to wait
half an appeal to complete the over, but that was definitely outside the line
a foot outside off stump again, but less carry this time. Left alone either way
left alone again, hitting his areas, as the press conference will doubtless reiterate
good wheels, Daren, good wheels
a touch misdirected, Kallis feigns an attempted cut
wider of the crease and speared in towards off stump. Kallis responds with a clumping drive, but cover intercepts
good line and length, defended in front of off stump
back in the channel to finish a fine over
two steps down the track and a mow across the line. A hint of frustration creeping in?
good reply, beaten outside off stump. This is a very encouraging start for West Indies
smeared, but completely miscued. The cameras were looking towards cover, but square leg picked up
good bowling, outside off and left alone with a curtain-rail leave of the bat
pushed back onto the stumps, and picked up at point
great delivery, just tailing back into the right-hander, but still beating his outside edge. Nothing for South Africa to get their teeth into at the mo
too straight, Kallis nudges to leg for a single
full, pacey and widey but not quite wide enough to be wided
nice bit of swing there away from the right hander who crisply times it to mid-off
an absolute village shot from Gibbs. Short and wide, he wafted at it outside off. No feet movement, beaten by the swing - no feet movement
that's much more like it. A confident pull through midwicket for four. He was quickly back into his crease, up on his toes and bashed it through the leg side
well wide and signalled a wide by the umpire
a dibbly dobbler outside off, hinting at moving back into Kallis who's defending
Kallis marches down the pitch. Rampaul sent it shorter and wider and Kallis tried to dab it down to third man but missed
cutting back into Kallis who is right behind it and defends watchfully
so close! A lovely delivery which swings and cuts away from Kallis, who fished at it outside off. Very close indeed
not very close this time though. He's utterly spanked this past point for four. He gave that some tremendous humpty
a leg-side bouncer...so short, in fact, that's it's been wided
shot. It wasn't that short but he heaved it over midwicket with immense power
he goes for a swish and misses - well wide of the off stump
left alone outside off
oh dear, and another wide from Powell. Not a good start this
neat stroke, whipping this behind square through midwicket
oh yes! Take that. The most orthodox of back-foot drives, cracking it for four. Beautiful
edged, but four! Well bowled, Powell. He found the outside edge and Browne got a fingertip to it, but no more than that and it flew down to the boundary
keeps a touch low and balloons off his pads down to third man, who is sleeping, and they pick up two
ignored outside off. Well left
steered behind square for a single - in fact, for two. More rubbish fielding. I mean, honestly, they really don't help themselves sometimes
dabbed down to third man
plays and misses to a wideish ball outside off. Nicely taken by Browne
another four - and he's given it as wides. Gibbs went to slog it over midwicket, missed it - as did Browne - and it flew down past the keeper
bang. That'll do. A beautiful cover drive for four. South Africa are buzzing
he picks this up through mid-on...or nearly, as Lewis pulls off an excellent save diving to his right
and he plays and misses outside off to end the over
he's a bit late on this and gets a thick inside edge
another crisply struck drive off the back foot but straight to mid-off this time
that's deft. A fraction wide of the off stump, Kallis opens the blade and guides it past the wicketkeeper for four. Top class
nice bit of swing away from Kallis who is beaten
Kallis marches down; Bravo drops it short; Kallis cuts it, with a dance of the feet, out to deep extra
flayed through cover for a single
very full. Gibbs tries to drive it through the onside but can only smite it back to the bowler
shorter, Gibbs tries to smash this into the road over midwicket - an awful slog. And why? - and gets a top edge over the wicketkeeper
tries to dab this down to third man but misses
pulled past short midwicket for a couple
a dance down the pitch and he times it beautifully, but straight to deep extra cover. Oh no, the throw is a miles wide and no one's backing up
there he goes! Another four, slashing at this and cutting it hard past backward point. Third man hasn't a hope
good length but it's too straight and the fielders are too deep. It's nudged for a single
shot. That is a fantastic strike from Gibbs, taking half a step down the pitch before opening his shoulders, going inside out, over long-off
oh he's unstoppable now. Gibbs flays this awfully wide ball without care, over point, for another four
miles wide of the off stump. That barely hit the cut strip
a good slower ball but he plays it well, nudging to leg. Smith fields well, diving at midwicket
a heck of a shot from Kallis this time. He stepped down the pitch and bullied it through midwicket. A Matthew Hayden-esque bash through the leg side
another wide outside off
oh that's unfair, really. Kallis marched towards the bowler who sent it a touch wider. Kallis cut, it edged past the wicketkeeper and went for four
he has smoked that! Absolutely steamed it through the covers but there's a sweeper out there
a dot ball - rejoice. Defended on the front foot
squeezed out to cover
Gibbs stands tall and cracks it in front of square
nurdled to leg
punched to long-off for his fifty
an orthodox, calm drive out to the off side
he tries to whip this through the leg side but misses
cracking cover drive but just for a single
cut down to third man
guided down to third man
wided outside off. Bravo's not happy because Kallis played a stroke to that...
down on one knee, it's creamed along the turf square of the wicket
width, and slashed past point. That's gone once again. He's utterly flying
turned into the leg-side, to no avail
a change of pace, and that's clobbered up up and away into the crowd, all the way for a maximum. Down on one knee, and beasted!
keeps the strike as well. Top batting
pushed into the covers, no great intent that time
pinged around the corner, that wasn't the worst delivery, but it simply flew past fine leg, who was up in the circle
swung away to third man off a thick edge. Fielded on the bounce. Gibbs hasn't held back since the break. I think he was getting bored with the waiting
nicely angled and well paced too. Just slow enough to scamper through for two, as third man swooped in
full length, and pushed back down the ground to long-on
that is an incredible strike. Power and placement, sizzles past the sweeper on the point boundary, who only had five yards to make up, but couldn't!
tucked off the pads to midwicket. Gibbs back on strike
instant call for a dab into the off-side, Sammy swooped and shied, and that could have been overthrows but the batsmen were fully committed to survival
defended off middle stump. The most respectful shot since the resumption
pushed into the covers
pitches outside leg, Gibbs lines up a slog sweep but makes no contact
a heave and a miss, a tad reckless that time. Impressive effort from the wristspinner. Three off the over
pushed off the back foot into the covers. Tidy start
swept, very fine, in fact it hit only the pad
props forward and defends
tickled off the pads and an easy jogged single ensues
Gibbs dances at the crease, eager to get on with it, but the lack of pace confounds his timing
full toss, pushed down to long-on
pushed down the ground again, and another jogged single
swept, effectively, down to fine leg
driven, a suspicion of an inside-edge, but fielded at midwicket
makes room to clobber it, but the bowler fields in his followthrough
defended out of the rough. This is very effective bowling in the circumstances
nudged into the covers, and that's a fine over
pushed coolly into the covers
picks the gap in front of point, and Kallis jogs through for his half-century
oh dear, that's a bit village. A meaty clobber from Gibbs, but deep cover nutmegs himself as he runs round to field
hit well, but Chanderpaul intercepts
slowly turning out of the rough, met with a full-blooded sweep
driven again, and fielded by the bowler again
Mother of God that's huge. Gave himself oodles of room, and simply launched through the line. Umpteen rows back
tucked into the leg side
rotates the strike again
short, too short, and dispatched through square leg with the greatest of ease
another monstrous wind-up, but no connection this time
turned off the hip, fielded on the 45
dabbed into the deep, and a jogged single brings Gibbs back on strike
down the track, looking for the big one, but doesn't quite connect. Long-on fields
tapped back to the bowler
another dot ball. That rarest of beasts
pushed to point, and through for a single
low full toss, smeared straight down the ground, and fielded on the slide five yards inside the rope
speared into the pads - you can't bowl there - but fine leg does very well with a scrambling stop
full toss, and a measured push back up the ground
slower ball, full length delivery - almost a yorker, and Gibbs is beaten outside off
oh dear oh dear oh dear. Gibbs goes to 99 with the most awful of misfields from Runako Morton. A slow-roller to deep midwicket rolls ... straight ... through ... his ... legs
that's it! A pumped drive through the covers, and that's Gibbs' 20th ODI century. From just 80 balls to boot. Well batted sir
still the extras keep coming
defended into the leg side, and the game is all but up
low full-toss, swatted out to long-on
ironic cheers as Morton finally picks one up in the deep
nudged down to long-off
leg-stump line, no room to swing the bat
defended off a good length, well bowled again
tried to make room for a cut, but wasn't quite there
rotates the strike once again, and the end is now nigh
tame ending. In the slot for the drive, but Gibbs got underneath it and slotted it into the covers
off the mark straightaway with a nudge to the leg side. The crowd roars again
good yorker, well dug out
short and swung away to deep square leg
defended off the back foot, and that's the end of the over
elegant drive, finds the gap at short cover, but swept up on the boundary's edge
down the track and defended back to the bowler
smeared down to third man off a thick edge. Pollock's back on strike to the crowd's intense approval
firmly driven to deep cover, and each run is greeted like a member of Boyzone entering a Smash Hits party
picked up in the covers
stand and deliver! Utterly flogged on the up, through the covers, beating fielders diving left and right
opens the face for an attempted glide to third man, but point swoops round to field
Pollock advances, but ends up yorking himself. Bravo fields in his followthrough
clipped firmly down to long-on. Kallis thinks about a second, but only for a second ...
slower ball, in the blockhole again, squeezed down the ground for a single
clunked back past the flailing bowler. Pollock is content to take the slow route to victory. Maybe he's savouring every last ball
change of pace, pushed into the deep
now that's unfortunate, Kallis drives into the covers, makes his ground, the ball hits the base of the stumps and ricochets all the way for five overthrows
no foot movement from Pollock as he wafted outside off, but now he can win it in one shot, should he so wish
ooh, good delivery. Pollock half-thought about a swing, but ended up being beaten outside off
full length, pushed out to cover
what a roar from the Bullring! Rampaul was too full, and Pollock slotted that through the covers. Two balls left in this over, two to win ...
he's done it! Short and wide outside off, a swished upper-cut down to third man, and they scamper back for two
